import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd 
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
plt.style.use('seaborn')

%matplotlib inline

top5 = df[['Name', 'Marks ', 'Percentage']].sort_values(by='Marks ',ascending=False).head(5)

plt.title("Top5 Students with highest marks")

source.d9ba6cc7:
def get_subject_hist(subject):
    sub_hist = df[subject]
    sns.histplot(x=sub_hist,element='bars')
    plt.title(f"Frequency of {subject} subject.")
    plt.xlabel(f"{subject} marks.")
    plt.show()
source.faa0bbdf:
subjects = ['Physics', 'Chemistry', 'Mathematics', 'Biology','Computer Science', 'English',]
for subject in subjects:
    get_subject_hist(subject)
    print("\n")
source.9eb43f07:
for subject in subjects:
    plt.plot(df[subject])
    plt.title(f"{subject} Marks")
    plt.xlabel("S.No")
    plt.ylabel("Marks")
    plt.show()
source.1325caf0:
def get_top5_subject_wise(subject):
    top5 = df[['Name',f'{subject}']].sort_values(by=f'{subject}',ascending=False).head(5)
    
    sns.barplot(data=top5, y='Name', x=f'{subject}',)
    plt.title(f"Top5 Students of {subject} subject")
    plt.xlabel("Marks")
    plt.show()
    
    print('\n')
source.56f347f6:
avg_of_each_subject= df.describe().drop('Total',axis=1).loc['mean'][0:6]
sns.barplot(x=avg_of_each_subject,y=avg_of_each_subject.keys())
plt.xlabel('Mean Score')
plt.title("Average Marks of each subject")
plt.show()
